Q51: Due to the political changes in the district that can negatively impact students, we formed a Beacon Zone, where we have champions of our programming and assist us with advocacy, promotion and resources.  This year, I have leaned heavily on my teams and small teams can be the catalyst needed to make the systemic changes in education.  Another example is our equity work.  We brought together teachers, predominantly white, from all of our schools to identify their biases so we can take it down to our kids.  As you mentioned, give the schools the problem to solve and give them the flexibility to meet the goal.      I oversee both KBMS and GBMS but only filled out one survey.  Thanks

Q22_0_GROUP: A: Desire to be on the cutting edge and demonstrate what’s possible,H: Stakeholder demand or advocacy, e.g., from the community, district leadership, teachers, or state agency,C: Lack of student agency
Q23: The success of Health Leadership High School's model is measured by student outcomes. Every student is provided individualized supports that meet their needs. Opportunities to have access to dual credit programming as well as certifications, allow students to develop strong resumes that support post secondary opportunities. Through experiential and project-based learning, students develop as deep and complex thinkers to have a broad understanding of the determinants of improving healthier communities.
Q51: Due to COVID-19 and school closures, Health Leadership High School had to make a shift in how student exhibitions of learning were presented. The HLHS staff created an online portal/Zoom event, in which community members/families/HLHS staff were able to virtually participate in student exhibitions and celebrations of learning. In addition, HLHS continued student internship and practicum placements. Students participated virtually at various agencies and medical clinics throughout Albuquerque as well as Care Calls to support Aging and Long Term services to set up COVID Vaccines for our elderly community.
District: Stand-alone charter authorized by Albuquerque Public Schools
